title: The Dow Drops 122 Points Because U.S. Manufacturing Shrank for the Second Month in a Row
text:
The Dow Drops 122 Points Because U.S. Manufacturing Shrank for the Second Month in a Row

Text size

Illustration by Michael George Haddad

Stocks are falling because U.S. manufacturing shrank for the second consecutive month. The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 122.49 points, or 0.46%, to 26,794.34. The S&P 500 fell 10.20 points, or 0.34%, to 2966.54, and the Nasdaq Composite slipped 12.78, or 0.16%, to 7986.56.

The Institute for Supply Management Purchasing Managers Index, or PMI, came in at 47.8 for September. The PMI is a survey of manufacturing businesses across the country, and the latest figure is the second straight reading below 50, which indicates contraction. Above 50 represents expansion. The latest PMI reading is also the lowest reading since June 2009.
